content.p: Look at the adjoining image. Each of the major organs of the urinary system is labeled with a number.

body.p: Identify each organ from the above image.

response.feedback: Correct. The kidneys filter blood to form urine.
Incorrect. The pancreas is superior to these organs.
Incorrect. The urinary bladder is inferior to these organs.
Incorrect. The urethra is inferior to these organs.

part.hint: This organ filters blood to form urine.
This organ looks like the type of bean often found in chili.

response.feedback: Correct. Ureters transport urine excreted from the kidneys to the bladder.
Incorrect. The urinary bladder receives the fluid from these tubes.
Incorrect. These tubes are much smaller than the small intestine.
Incorrect. The urethra is inferior to these organs.

part.hint: These tubes transport urine excreted from the kidneys to the bladder.

response.feedback: Correct. The urinary bladder stores urine.
Incorrect. This structure is posterior to the large intestine.
Incorrect. The ureters are paired tubes superior to this organ.
Incorrect. The urethra is inferior to this organ.

part.hint: This organ stores urine until it is eliminated from the body.

response.feedback: Correct. The urethra carries urine to exit the body.
Incorrect. The urinary bladder drains fluid into this tube.
Incorrect. The kidneys are the larger paired organs superior to this organ.
Incorrect. The ureters are the superior to these organs.

part.hint: Urine travels through this channel to exit the body.
